rComments: Terrible prof. Tests didn't reflect lecture material, instructions were never clear, and doesn't divy up time for difficult concepts. Oftentimes rushes through questions in lecture and doesn't engage students well. Tests were unfairly difficult, and Ramya never remarked regardless of whether or not there were legitimate marking errors. Do not take.

Genuinely had a terrible time in this class. Lectures are boring, no breaks. She was mean to me when I asked a super basic question, refused to correct mistakes she made with the test answer key that cost everyone a large % of TT1. There was also material we didnt cover on there!! Exam dropped people 5-30% as well.
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', 'Lecture heavy', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: She doesn't know how to teach AT ALL. If you take STA215 DO NOT CHOOSE RAMYA AS YOUR PROF. She doesn't explain properly, she just goes through one example per concept. She spends an inordinate amount of time going step by step for simple calculations like standard deviation (things you already know), leaving no time for actually difficult concepts.
she's rude to her students when they ask her questions.

This professor is complete garbage, but dont expect much its Stats dept afterall. Her teaching is avg at best, shes a complete b-word. And honestly, has the most annoying voice in the whole world. She just says that many people drop the course, and then just laughs. Maybe if you taught better, gave fair assessments people wouldnt drop.

The only reason I showed to lecture was because there was no other way of passing this course, if the textbook was at-least informative, i wouldn't have struggled so much with it, our TA even said this 'online' textbook was for 'babies' his words. The prof really didn't know how to explain things and her past tests were easy compared to our tests.
teacherRatingTags: ['Test heavy', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Tough grader']

rComments: Honestly the only reason why I showed up was for the participation marks. The textbook honestly does just as good of a job at explaining what she's trying to say. I'd say maybe ask your friends for lecture notes incase she throws a curveball but really theres not much a point in going. She spent 4 classes on one lecture once, don't even know why.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Get ready to read', 'Participation matters']

rComments: Professor Ramya is an awesome professor. She explains things in her lectures clearly, she has extra office hours right before important tests, and she posts the lecture notes and past tests (and even the solutions to them) online on blackboard. If you put in the work, you can be successful in her class!

She is a great prof. Her lectures are so organized and she is so well prepared for everything. I really understood statistics after taking it with her. I am trying to take more courses with her in the future.
Only if every prof was as clear as her when lecturing :) Attend lectures, take good notes, put in the work, and you will do great. Simply loved her. She made everything interesting !

I was not looking forward to this course as stats is  labelled boring. To my surprise the prof made lectures interesting and her passion made the course enjoyable. She is one of the only profs who cares if we understand and lets us ask questions during lectures. R assignments were hard but she helped during office hours and on discussion board.
The professor's lecture notes were very helpful for studying, clear speaking, and lots of examples. She was helpful during office hours and on the discussion board.

Overall course material is not hard, comparing to calculus except for the annoying stat program, R. I could see her passion with teaching, but her speech is non-stop, her voice is very sharp and loud (With Mic as Well) during lectures that makes students have hard times to listen what she have said.

She is a good professor and you can tell that she is really passionate about the course material. But, this was a terrible course. The course required you to use a program called R, which is fundamental in statistics, but it is such a pain to use. This course is designed for biology majors, so the material isn't overly complicated but super boring.

The course is too heavily based on using R. The purpose of this course is to learn about statistics not to learn about how to use R! Assignment information and instructions are very vague and lacking. Don't understand the assignment's requirements? Ask her on Blackboard and expect little to no help at all.

Worst thing was she has a very sharp voice and she always has her mic loud lol. Aside from that she wasnt very supportive when i asked her for help and she doesnt spend enough time on important lecture material. If you put in a lot of work and focus yourself you'll be fine.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lots of homework', 'Lecture heavy', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: okay, practice past tests!!
She's a great prof and her lectures are easy to follow. If you have all the notes and practice her past tests you are guaranteed to do well on her real tests because they are so similar
Don't like her teaching style and she goes too fast. But her tests are very similar to past tests that she posts and are fairly easy.
It just not good
